00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * interface to the low latency DRAM
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 106434 $<hr>
00046  *
00047  */
00048 
00049 #ifndef __CVMX_LLM_H__
00050 #define __CVMX_LLM_H__
00051 
00052 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00053 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00054 extern "C" {
00055 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 #define ENABLE_DEPRECATED   /* Set to enable the old 18/36 bit names */
00059 
00060 typedef enum {
00061     CVMX_LLM_REPLICATION_NONE = 0,
00062     CVMX_LLM_REPLICATION_2X = 1,    // on both interfaces, or 2x if only one interface
00063     CVMX_LLM_REPLICATION_4X = 2,    // both interfaces, 2x, or 4x if only one interface
00064     CVMX_LLM_REPLICATION_8X = 3,    // both interfaces, 4x,  or 8x if only one interface
00065 } cvmx_llm_replication_t;
00066 
00067 /**
00068  * This structure defines the address used to the low-latency memory.
00069  * This address format is used for both loads and stores.
00070  */
00071 typedef union {
00072     uint64_t u64;
00073     struct {
00074         uint64_t mbz:30;
00075         cvmx_llm_replication_t repl:2;
00076         uint64_t address:32;    // address<1:0> mbz, address<31:30> mbz
00077     } s;
00078 } cvmx_llm_address_t;
00079 
00080 /**
00081  * This structure defines the data format in the low-latency memory
00082  */
00083 typedef union {
00084     uint64_t u64;
00085 
00086     /**
00087      * this format defines the format returned on a load
00088      *   a load returns the 32/36-bits in memory, plus xxor = even_parity(dat<35:0>)
00089      *   typically, dat<35> = parity(dat<34:0>), so the xor bit directly indicates parity error
00090      *   Note that the data field size is 36 bits on the 36XX/38XX, and 32 bits on the 31XX
00091      */
00092     struct {
00093         uint64_t mbz1:27;
00094         uint64_t xxor:1;
00095         uint64_t mbz:4;
00096         uint64_t dat:32;
00097     } cn31xx;
00098 
00099     struct {
00100         uint64_t mbz:27;
00101         uint64_t xxor:1;
00102         uint64_t dat:36;
00103     } s;
00104 
00105     /**
00106      *  This format defines what should be used if parity is desired.  Hardware returns
00107      *  the XOR of all the bits in the 36/32 bit data word, so for parity software must use
00108      * one of the data field bits as a parity bit.
00109      */
00110     struct cn31xx_par_struct {
00111         uint64_t mbz:32;
00112         uint64_t par:1;
00113         uint64_t dat:31;
00114     } cn31xx_par;
00115     struct cn38xx_par_struct {
00116         uint64_t mbz:28;
00117         uint64_t par:1;
00118         uint64_t dat:35;
00119     } cn38xx_par;
00120 #if !OCTEON_IS_COMMON_BINARY()
00121 #if CVMX_COMPILED_FOR(OCTEON_CN31XX)
00122     struct cn31xx_par_struct spar;
00123 #else
00124     struct cn38xx_par_struct spar;
00125 #endif
00126 #endif
00127 } cvmx_llm_data_t;
00128 
00129 #define CVMX_LLM_NARROW_DATA_WIDTH  ((CVMX_COMPILED_FOR(OCTEON_CN31XX)) ? 32 : 36)
00130 
00131 extern int CVMX_SHARED cvmx_llm_num_ports;
00132 /**
00133  * Calculate the parity value of a number
00134  *
00135  * @param value
00136  * @return parity value
00137  */
00138 static inline uint64_t cvmx_llm_parity(uint64_t value)
00139 {
00140     uint64_t result;
00141     CVMX_DPOP(result, value);
00142     return result;
00143 }
00144 
00145 /**
00146  * Calculate the ECC needed for 36b LLM mode
00147  *
00148  * @param value
00149  * @return  ECC value
00150  */ static inline int cvmx_llm_ecc(uint64_t value)
00151 {
00152     static const uint32_t ecc_code_29[7] = {
00153         0x08962595,
00154         0x112a4aaa,
00155         0x024c934f,
00156         0x04711c73,
00157         0x0781e07c,
00158         0x1801ff80,
00159         0x1ffe0000
00160     };
00161     uint64_t pop0, pop1, pop2, pop3, pop4, pop5, pop6;
00162 
00163     pop0 = ecc_code_29[0];
00164     pop1 = ecc_code_29[1];
00165     pop2 = ecc_code_29[2];
00166     pop0 &= value;
00167     pop3 = ecc_code_29[3];
00168     CVMX_DPOP(pop0, pop0);
00169     pop4 = ecc_code_29[4];
00170     pop1 &= value;
00171     CVMX_DPOP(pop1, pop1);
00172     pop2 &= value;
00173     pop5 = ecc_code_29[5];
00174     CVMX_DPOP(pop2, pop2);
00175     pop6 = ecc_code_29[6];
00176     pop3 &= value;
00177     CVMX_DPOP(pop3, pop3);
00178     pop4 &= value;
00179     CVMX_DPOP(pop4, pop4);
00180     pop5 &= value;
00181     CVMX_DPOP(pop5, pop5);
00182     pop6 &= value;
00183     CVMX_DPOP(pop6, pop6);
00184 
00185     return ((pop6 & 1) << 6) | ((pop5 & 1) << 5) | ((pop4 & 1) << 4) | ((pop3 & 1) << 3) | ((pop2 & 1) << 2) | ((pop1 & 1) << 1) | (pop0 & 1);
00186 }
00187 
00188 #ifdef ENABLE_DEPRECATED
00189 /* These macros are provided to provide compatibility with code that uses
00190 ** the old names for the llm access functions.  The names were changed
00191 ** when support for the 31XX llm was added, as the widths differ between Octeon Models.
00192 ** The wide/narrow names are preferred, and should be used in all new code */
00193 #define cvmx_llm_write36 cvmx_llm_write_narrow
00194 #define cvmx_llm_read36  cvmx_llm_read_narrow
00195 #define cvmx_llm_write64 cvmx_llm_write_wide
00196 #define cvmx_llm_read64  cvmx_llm_read_wide
00197 #endif
00198 /**
00199  * Write to LLM memory - 36 bit
00200  *
00201  * @param address Address in LLM to write. Consecutive writes increment the
00202  *                address by 4. The replication mode is also encoded in this
00203  *                address.
00204  * @param value   Value to write to LLM. Only the low 36 bits will be used.
00205  * @param set     Which of the two coprocessor 2 register sets to use for the
00206  *                write. May be used to get two outstanding LLM access at once
00207  *                per core. Range: 0-1
00208  */
00209 static inline void cvmx_llm_write_narrow(cvmx_llm_address_t address, uint64_t value, int set)
00210 {
00211     cvmx_llm_data_t data;
00212     data.s.mbz = 0;
00213 
00214     data.s.dat = value;
00215 
00216     data.s.xxor = 0;
00217 
00218     if (set) {
00219         CVMX_MT_LLM_DATA(1, data.u64);
00220         CVMX_MT_LLM_WRITE_ADDR_INTERNAL(1, address.u64);
00221     } else {
00222         CVMX_MT_LLM_DATA(0, data.u64);
00223         CVMX_MT_LLM_WRITE_ADDR_INTERNAL(0, address.u64);
00224     }
00225 }
00226 
00227 /**
00228  * Write to LLM memory - 64 bit
00229  *
00230  * @param address Address in LLM to write. Consecutive writes increment the
00231  *                address by 8. The replication mode is also encoded in this
00232  *                address.
00233  * @param value   Value to write to LLM.
00234  * @param set     Which of the two coprocessor 2 register sets to use for the
00235  *                write. May be used to get two outstanding LLM access at once
00236  *                per core. Range: 0-1
00237  */
00238 static inline void cvmx_llm_write_wide(cvmx_llm_address_t address, uint64_t value, int set)
00239 {
00240     if (set) {
00241         CVMX_MT_LLM_DATA(1, value);
00242         CVMX_MT_LLM_WRITE64_ADDR_INTERNAL(1, address.u64);
00243     } else {
00244         CVMX_MT_LLM_DATA(0, value);
00245         CVMX_MT_LLM_WRITE64_ADDR_INTERNAL(0, address.u64);
00246     }
00247 }
00248 
00249 /**
00250  * Read from LLM memory - 36 bit
00251  *
00252  * @param address Address in LLM to read. Consecutive reads increment the
00253  *                address by 4. The replication mode is also encoded in this
00254  *                address.
00255  * @param set     Which of the two coprocessor 2 register sets to use for the
00256  *                write. May be used to get two outstanding LLM access at once
00257  *                per core. Range: 0-1
00258  * @return The lower 36 bits contain the result of the read
00259  */
00260 static inline cvmx_llm_data_t cvmx_llm_read_narrow(cvmx_llm_address_t address, int set)
00261 {
00262     cvmx_llm_data_t value;
00263     if (set) {
00264         CVMX_MT_LLM_READ_ADDR(1, address.u64);
00265         CVMX_MF_LLM_DATA(1, value.u64);
00266     } else {
00267         CVMX_MT_LLM_READ_ADDR(0, address.u64);
00268         CVMX_MF_LLM_DATA(0, value.u64);
00269     }
00270     return value;
00271 }
00272 
00273 /**
00274  * Read from LLM memory - 64 bit
00275  *
00276  * @param address Address in LLM to read. Consecutive reads increment the
00277  *                address by 8. The replication mode is also encoded in this
00278  *                address.
00279  * @param set     Which of the two coprocessor 2 register sets to use for the
00280  *                write. May be used to get two outstanding LLM access at once
00281  *                per core. Range: 0-1
00282  * @return The result of the read
00283  */
00284 static inline uint64_t cvmx_llm_read_wide(cvmx_llm_address_t address, int set)
00285 {
00286     uint64_t value;
00287     if (set) {
00288         CVMX_MT_LLM_READ64_ADDR(1, address);
00289         CVMX_MF_LLM_DATA(1, value);
00290     } else {
00291         CVMX_MT_LLM_READ64_ADDR(0, address);
00292         CVMX_MF_LLM_DATA(0, value);
00293     }
00294     return value;
00295 }
00296 
00297 #define RLD_INIT_DELAY  (1<<18)
00298 
00299 /* This structure describes the RLDRAM configuration for a board.  This structure
00300 ** must be populated with the correct values and passed to the initialization function.
00301 */
00302 typedef struct {
00303     uint32_t cpu_hz;    /* CPU frequency in Hz */
00304     char addr_rld0_fb_str[100]; /* String describing RLDRAM connections on rld 0 front (0) bunk */
00305     char addr_rld0_bb_str[100]; /* String describing RLDRAM connections on rld 0 back (1) bunk */
00306     char addr_rld1_fb_str[100]; /* String describing RLDRAM connections on rld 1 front (0) bunk */
00307     char addr_rld1_bb_str[100]; /* String describing RLDRAM connections on rld 1 back (1) bunk */
00308     uint8_t rld0_bunks; /* Number of bunks on rld 0 (0 is disabled) */
00309     uint8_t rld1_bunks; /* Number of bunks on rld 1 (0 is disabled) */
00310     uint16_t rld0_mbytes;   /* mbytes on rld 0 */
00311     uint16_t rld1_mbytes;   /* mbytes on rld 1 */
00312     uint16_t max_rld_clock_mhz; /* Maximum RLD clock in MHz, only used for CN58XX */
00313 } llm_descriptor_t;
00314 
00315 /**
00316  * Initialize LLM memory controller.  This must be done
00317  * before the low latency memory can be used.
00318  * This is simply a wrapper around cvmx_llm_initialize_desc(),
00319  * and is deprecated.
00320  *
00321  * @return -1 on error
00322  *         0 on success
00323  */
00324 int cvmx_llm_initialize(void);
00325 
00326 /**
00327  * Initialize LLM memory controller.  This must be done
00328  * before the low latency memory can be used.
00329  *
00330  * @param llm_desc_ptr
00331  *              Pointer to descriptor structure. If NULL
00332  *              is passed, a default setting is used if available.
00333  *
00334  * @return -1 on error
00335  *         Size of llm in bytes on success
00336  */
00337 int cvmx_llm_initialize_desc(llm_descriptor_t * llm_desc_ptr);
00338 
00339 /**
00340  * Gets the default llm descriptor for the board code is being run on.
00341  *
00342  * @param llm_desc_ptr
00343  *               Pointer to descriptor structure to be filled in.  Contents are only
00344  *               valid after successful completion.  Must not be NULL.
00345  *
00346  * @return -1 on error
00347  *         0 on success
00348  */
00349 
00350 int cvmx_llm_get_default_descriptor(llm_descriptor_t * llm_desc_ptr);

00352 /**
00353  * Sets the number of ports in llm configuration.
00354  * @param num_ports  number of ports
00355  */
00356 void cvmx_llm_config_set_num_ports(int num_ports);
